Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 22 for SLE 15 SP2)

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel (Live Patch 22 for SLE 15 SP2)
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 5.3.18-24_96 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2022-0185: Incorrect param length parsing in legacy_parse_param which could have led to a local privilege escalation (bsc#1194517).

Vulnerabilities.Description: A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in the way the legacy_parse_param function in the Filesystem Context functionality of the Linux kernel verified the supplied parameters length. An unprivileged (in case of unprivileged user namespaces enabled, otherwise needs namespaced CAP_SYS_ADMIN privilege) local user able to open a filesystem that does not support the Filesystem Context API (and thus fallbacks to legacy handling) could use this flaw to escalate their privileges on the system.
